values:
Yeah I'm still alive and still here in GA.
 Listen, I need help(yeah yeah I know)keep thwe wise cracks down to a minium please.
 I need someone with sculpting ability to sculpt me a wolf skull out of sculpty  about 3 in long and about 1 1/2 wide at it's widest point.
www.hideandfur.com has some  great pics of a wolf skull in several different views.

 Anyone can help on this please let me know.

 Thanks and talk to ya'll later.
Wolf

Whew!
 Kim's boss is going to co sign with me for the loan. This will enable us to pay 2 months rent and get caught up with things.
 We've been playing catch up since we moved in and it's been killing us. But now that problem will be solved.
So we get to keep the house and we get to stay together as a family.

On another note, Kim's daughter, Courtney, who lives with her dad, down in Griffin, will be moving in with us after she gets out of school. Kim and I are both VERY excited and can't wait. We'll now have both children with us! Let the headaches begin!!! LOL

Other than that, things are goin well.
Hey Bird!! If you're reading this, I'll drop you an email later! Been way too busy and tired from work to respond! Tell Kada Hey!!And I tell her I got me a fiesty smartass redneck too!

Ya'll take care!

Anyone who knows me willing to co sign on a loan with me so I don't my house and family?
It'll be for $1800-3500, depending on co signers credit. Mine's bad enough to need a co signer. But at least the didn't flat out tell me no.

Life's goin pretty well out here. Kim's engagement ring finally got here and she totally went bonkers! Absolutly loves it! called her momma and told her about it and went and showed it to Deb, our next door neighbor.
 We're still struggleing with bills and such but we're getting closer than ever before. I finally found that piece of the puzzle I've been missing.
 Her children love me and her folks and family think I'm the greatest. Matter of fact, her mom called me tonight to wish me a happy birthday and to see if I got my card and we talked for a while. Later, Kim commented that her mom talked to me longer than she did her! Just had to grin at that!
Work's going ok. Hitting the burn out zone though. Working 10-12 hour day plus the 1 1/2 hour ride to and from work is starting to get to me. I leave the house at 4:30am. Yuck!

 But other than that, doing good out here way out in Paulding county.

Saturday night on our way home from picking up Courtney, she says to me after hearing me sing an old Whitesnake tune, " You've got a great voice daddy. You need to be on American Idol!"

I just love my daughter!

While I know that it's still some tme before the wedding, it's damn frustarting to not be able to find that one place where we want to have our wedding, someplace that let's us decorate the way we want to and Not cost us an arm and a leg plus our first newborn(should that ever happen).

While there has been one suggestion< (Thanks Elvis!) It just not quite what we're looking for, and it's starting to get me just a bit miffed.

Well thank the gods we have a year + to find the place.

there are times when I have to ask myself  "Why do I bother?"

Just when I think things are looking up and we're gonna be okay. Another damn wrench gets thrown into the works and it hell on wheels all over again.

I need a vacation from life!! just for a little while.

Anyone know of anyone looking for part time labor. I'm looking for a night job maybe 5-6pm-till midnight.

Doesn't have to pay alot but right now any little bit helps.

Anyone know of a secluded cabin rental place either here in Georgia or somewhere withing the  surrounding states?
Been working way too hard and I need a break from people, grinders, loud sounds, you name it!!!

any suggestions would be greatly appreciated...

Looks like my last enrty bombed out So I'll try this again. Does anyone know of any decent place located on the south side of ATL where I can have a wedding/ reception and decorate the way we want to? And does anyone know of and good bakeries that do custom work. Kim and I don't want a plain old wedding cake.

Also can anyone put me touch with <lj user="mistressbeauty">? If so then have her drop me an email at my Gmail account which is steelwolf at gmail dot com.

Yeah so I'm a little late.
 Anyway, I'm very much alive. I'd like some help. ok I NEED a lot of help. LOL

I'm looking for a place to have a wedding/reception somewhere along the south side of ATL. Some where that will let us decorate the way we want to and if anyone knows a really good bakery that does custome cakes that'll be good too!!

Drop me a line!!!

Wolf

Decided a couple of weeks ago that I would start drawing again.
 Now this may be a shock to some of you. Saying why haven't we seen your work before? Actually you have but it was my brush work. 

 What I do by drawing is what I call Animated Kanji.
 Now Kanji is the chinese or japanese symbols of a word. What I do is draw out the kanji of a certain word and give it the characteristics of the word.

 Example:Years ago I did a piece I gave away. Took me a month to finish it. It was called the 5 elemental dragons. What I did was draw the kanji for dragon and drew the kanji for the element above it. There are 5 elements: Earth, Wind, Fire, Water and the Void. I then colored and drew in aspects of the dragon's element.
 I've decided to start another one. I find it very relaxing and with my headphones one happen to fall into an almost zen like state. very relaxing.
 Brittany, Heath daughter, is absolutely mesmerized by my work. I'll have to make something for her for X-mas.
  As much as I'd like to write, seeing as how I have a great story brewing in my head, I've just got too much else running around in my head to write and I need a bit more think of my stories, Wolf in sheep's clothing and War of God and Man. The last one may get me burned at the stake as a heretic! LOL

 IN other news, the doctor released me back to full duty and I go into work tomorrow for my last day. Then it's Thanknsgiving here with one of my brothers and family. Then(sigh) Julie, Heath's wife conned Heath and I to get up well beofre the butt crack of dawn to go shopping on Black Friday. But as soon as I get back from that, it's load up my truck and head north. 
 Can't wait!!!

I know that my last entry was rather dark and forsaken but the events that caused that have since been smoothed over.
 I am now ME again. But really what I mean by the Subject heading is that this Wolf will be migrating North back into the Atlanta Ga region. 
 That's right. You read that right. I'm coming back to the Atlanta region. I have a job waiting for me in Canton, well Holly Springs actually. I'll be working at Hydro-Chem, where because my welding experince doesn't apply, i'll be a shop helper starting out but they do offer classes in MIG and TIG welding, which I will take advantage of whole heartedly.
 I'll be making more than I am right now, working almost the same amount of hours. It looks like I'll be pulling a 56 work week. Not a problem for me! 
  However, I'll be staying in the Doulasville area and living there about. Yeah I know, the drive will most likely kill me but I've driven farther before for work. and with the hours I'll be working, I should miss the brunt of traffic.

  I'll be leaving just after Thanksgiving. This way I can spend the holiday with Heath and Julie and the family down here and I'll be back down to see em at Xmas time.
 I just got the word late friday. I have to give notice at work and that sucks! Bill Cook, the man I work for is a great guy and I really hate to leave him with really only 3 days of notice since next weekn will be a 3 day work week and I'm out with a minor back injury and won't be cleared till Tuesday. Bill is one of those guys ever one should work for. He'll give you the shirt off his back to help out and he's easy to talk to. But this is an oppertunity that I can't pass up, not just for the money or the chance to learn 2 new types of welding but a chance to be Home.
   Now that may seem a bit puzzling for most but it was meant to be. Somewhere down the road, I'll let you all in on it.

 A Howl from the south!!!!

It's been said that "I hope you're having fun"
 This may sound vauge. What I say may be taken wrong by some people.

One of you who reads this knows the truth behind my words.

   I know what it feels like to Fall.
   Just as Lucifer Fell from the Heavens
   So do I know the feel.
   I have been content.
   I have experienced the LIFE I never thought
   I would be able to feel. The feeling of being
   Totally Alive

   And I have felt the one thing that I thought was Forever
   denied me:
    Happiness. But like Lucifer, it slipped through my grasp. 
    Unable to hold on to the dream.

    Now, I am cast back into the shadows.
     The Lonliness & Despair

    Some may say that this Karma. Punishment
    for past transgressions


    Now, from the Nothing I came, to the Nothing
     I return.


     I AM HOME!

Yeah I know I haven't posted in awhile. Who has time??!!

Work work and more work!  However this is good since I know have to seriously belt up my pants. I've gone down 4 belt notches and my clothes really don't fit any more. But lots more scars. Burns, cuts, scrapes etc.
 There's a lot going on and only one of you is really privy to that info on what's happening in the chaos that is my life! LOL

 But I'm still here and alive. For now! LOL

Well,
 Where we we're at, Wilma turned out to be nothing more than a bad storm. However the damage cause south of is massive!
 So we're alive. Nothing missing and no damage except for fallen branches.

 Now we have this damn cold front!! I'm in Florida dammit!. Just last week I was in jeans and T-shirt sweating my ass off. And now I'm bundled up like a damn eskimo! Just ain't right I tell ya!!!

Hurricane Wilma is here.
 My first hurricane. To be honest, it's not really worth writing about. Just a bad storm here. I know it would be a different matter if I was much farther south. But here in Maitland, just north of Orlando, it's lots of rain and strong winds. 
  Wind gusts here are about 20-30 mph. Been raining since about 11pm last night. May get worse here. Just don't know yet. They've  never seen a storm like this before. They've never had a tropical go to a Cat 5 in 24 hrs. Hell when this  one left Cozumel it was a Cat1. They said it'd hit Florida as Cat 1 maybe 2. Survey says "Wrong!" She made strength up to Cat 3 with winds of 125 mph.
 We'll just batten down the hatches and hunker down.

We are eagerly awaiting the more clearly projected path of Wilma. We know she's in the Caymans moving into the Gulf. 
 We will know more tomorrow as to where and more likely when she'll hit.

 I have never been through a hurricane before and am looking forward to it. 
 Been through way too many earthquakes. So many that those of us from California and pretty much tell the magnitude of the quake before the news tells us! LOL

 Also, One thing I can tell you is that with a hurricane like this, my new voicemail will sound something like this: "Hi, You reached Jason/Wolf's cell. I clocked in at 6am monday morning. I don't know what day it is but leave a message and I'll call you when I clock out. Thanks."

 Yeah it will be like that pretty much. I'll be putting in like a 100-125 hrs a week! No Kidding!! 4 hours of sleep a night in the truck and then on to work, tearing down old doors and putting up new ones.

This weekend, Heath and I are gonna be putting away all loose lawn furniture and getting ready just in case Wilma moves this way.

(Sigh) Oh Well, as they say: A body in motion stays in motion.

 Later,
 Wolf

Well,
 Been awhile since I did this!
 Some may have been wondering where I am. Most probably just don't care.

Anway, I'm down here in Florida. Yeah that's right! Land O Gators, Swamps and Hurricane Proving Grounds!

 I'm working for a company installing overhead doors. Much like you see in warehouse and such. Work all over Florida and work a hell of a lot of hours! I go in at 6am and usually don't get home till 8-10pm!

 Lost about 15 pounds and have gained back a bit of muscle. There's plenty of heavy lifting in my field of work and I won't even get started about the heat! Let's just say that about 10am my shirt's already soaked straight thru!

 Don't really wear my kilts anymore. Jeans and work shirts during the week and shorts and tank tops on the weekends.

 Other than that just staying alive and been keeping busy.

Just got back from seeing Four Brothers.


 Go see it!! Damn good!!!!

Hey Folks,
 Dragon Con is Just around the corner and I'll be working security.
 Years ago when I worked the Goon Squad at the Ren Faire back Home I was first aid/ CPR certified.
 Now while I'm not EMS or anything like that(and no it's not a requirement for DC security) But it would be nice to have my certs, ya know?
 SO my question is this:
 Where do I go in the ATL area for first aid/cpr certification?

AMAZINGLY SIMPLE HOME REMEDIES

1. If you are choking on an ice cube, don't panic. Simply pour a cup of boiling water down your throat and presto. The blockage will be almost instantly removed.

2. Clumsy? Avoid cutting yourself while slicing vegetables by getting someone else to hold them while you chop away.

3. Avoid arguments with the Mrs. about lifting the toilet seat by simply using the sink.

4. For high blood pressure sufferers: simply cut yourself and bleed for a few minutes, thus reducing the pressure in your veins. Remember to use a timer.

5. A mouse trap, placed on top of your alarm clock, will prevent you from rolling over and going back to sleep after you hit the snooze button.

6. If you have a bad cough, take a large dose of laxatives, then you will be afraid to cough.

7. Have a bad toothache? Smash your thumb with a hammer and you will forget about the toothache.

Sometimes, we just need to remember what the rules of life really are:
You only need two tools: WD-40 and Duct Tape.
If it doesn't move and should, use the WD-40.
If it shouldn't move and does, use the duct tape.

Ok, 
Soon as I can, I'll get a picture of those Ti-rings I was talking about and show em to you but what's even neater is the kydex neck sheaths I made for em!! These rock!!!

 Marva will be at Piper's tonight doing Karaoke. If you know where that is(cuz I don't) Stop by and check her's out!

Been a long weekend. Wasn't the greatest for me either.
 Thursday night I went to <lj user="thegreyman">'s and played X box games. PLayed Godzilla:Save the Earth. COOl game!! He brought home the projector and we played on the wall. No sissy tv screen for us!!

 We also played Crimson Skies. and we also played Star Wars Battlefront!! Yeah, I got to busta cap in an Ewok's ass!! Also got to busta cap in a Wookie's ass too!!

 Finally ended the night by playing Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Now that was a cool game too!!

 Friday Marva and I headed down to Clombus to see Justin of Ranger Knives. Yes Justin was a Ranger. Now he does security work over in Iraq. He was home for about a month. He didn't have the knife I was lkooking for cuz they were at the heat treater's. But He did have these really cool pieces called Ti-rings. They're a ppiece of titanium that's worn like a ring and has a small edge/blade so the ring can eitherr be worn blade out, like a push dagger or blade worn in, which can give a new meaning to bitch slap!
 Just is a great guy who makes simple, easy inexpensive knives for the regular working man. He's also very easy to talk to and deal with. For example, when we showed up, he only had a few minutes since he had to drop off 200 knives to be heat treated. Marva found a Ti-ring she liked but didn't quite fit her. Justin said "No problem!" Took it out to his shop and re sized it. That one didn't quite work out as he made it a little big. Grabbed another one and went back out and brought us with him and sized another one for her. Fit just right! Was there any xtra charge? Nope. not at all. As a matter of fact he even gave us a break on the price!
 Here's his website:http://www.rangerknives.com/

Now when we got to Albany and unloaded, I started to come down with something. And it wasn't nice!
 Missed the gig friday night, went out and had breakfast saturday and didn't feel any better. Basically I just stayed in bed in the hotel room all weekend. Feel better today. Still gonna take Nyquil in a couple of hours. Marva's gonna go do Karaoke tonight.

Today, <lj user="thegreyman"> and I went up to Gainesville to the Eastman Gun show. Didn't to much talking on the way up as he was making phone calls about Dragon Con.
 We got there and looked around. All I can say was thank God we we're both broke! Otherwise we would have both walked outta there, looking like we were ready for doomsday! LOL
On the way back we talked about books, movies and just chatted.
 He had to leave about 2pm for a DC meeting and I went into the shop.

 Made a cool holster for a Smith&Wesson Karambit and started a holster for a colt 1911 for <lj user="thegreyman">.
 Stopped about 6pm, took a shower and had a scottish dinner. Canned Haggis(yeah you read it right!) and Guiness and for desert a slice of single malt whiskey cake! YUM!!

 Now just doing laundry and waiting for <lj user="muffle1969"> to get home and tell her about my day.

 She's at work doing server stuff and hoping the system works with out flaws.

Yep Freedom reign is playing at Bogey's in Duluth!!

 Here's the info:Bogey's Neighborhood Grill
Address:   	3312 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Duluth, GA
Phone:	(678) 584-9559

 Not sure of the hours but most likey 9ish to 12-1ish. Ball park time of course.

Been playing around with my kydex..

 There's a few things I'm missing. I need certain grit sanding belts that these local homew shops don't have and I have to order and the right kind of buffing wheel.

 But other than that, I've made new sheaths for both of my leathermans, my leatherman micra, which is on my keychain and my desperado and marva's boot knife.

 Since she's gonna be working tomorrow I may head down to Gainsville  to see this:http://www.eastmangunshows.com/

 I'll look around and see if there's anyone making kydex holsters that I can get ideas on and maybe talk shop.

 Anyone wanna go with me?

Heat took a hell of a toll on me yesterday.
 When I lived in Mississippi, I worked out in the shipyards as a combo fitter.. Which means I can tack weld and use a torch. 
 Now the problem with this is it's not a cool job and in the summer time it really sucks! Why?
#1. Hell. It's not the heat. It's the humidity!! Ain't that the damn truth!! Humid weather like we had on the Gulf Coast suck ass!!

#2. I was basically creating large metal boxes. What I did was called sub- assembly. We built sections of the ships and sent em on for Final assembly. But overall, they were just big metal boxes.

#3 We didn't have air conditioning of any sort. We were lucky if we found a fan.

#4. And finally, most of the time I worked on these units outside. That's right! not only did I have to contend with heat from my torch and humidity, but I also had the sun pounding down from above.

 So what's this all got to do with me??  Heat Exhaustion. I've had it 3 times and on the 3rd time they wound up shipping me to the Hospital where I had 2500cc of fluid pumped into my system.

 So you can see, that this heat hits me faster and harder and you guys beacuse once you've had heat exhaustion, your body doesn't go back to the way it was and your body can't dissipate the heat absorbed as fast as other people.

 Ya see, I work in a building where there's no air conditioning, the roof is corragated steel above me with no insulation. So it's kinda like the shipyard all over again(except the pay here SUX!) Working in a metal box with the sun pounding down on that lovely steel roof!!

 I stopped sweating around 5pm yesterday. Not a good sign. First sign of Heat Exhaustion. Now I was drinking water and gatorade like they were going outta style. But I just couldn't keep it in, even though I went to the bathroom like 3 times. Luckily I was able to cool down and get more  fluids into me and started sweating again.

 Other problem that is associated is called muscle cramps. Now even though I didn't have em really, my body this moring felt like I had a hell of a work out and not in A good way.

Went into work for a bit and didn't feel so good so I came home and cooled down.

 Need a different job. this one sucks. Think I'll do that friday. Look into Monster and AJC and see what's in there.

All my Kydex stuff showed up today!!! Woo Hoo!!

 The down side: This damn heat is brutal on me considering that I've had heat exhaustion 3 times and I'm too wiped out in the eveneing to do much of anything.

 Looks like I'll be playing mad scientist friday morning..

Well it's sunday.

 Firday night Freedom Reign played a place called Sportsline. You may have seen my friday post about that. And if you've read <lj user="muffle1969">'s saturday post then you know that went well.

 Yesterday <lj user="muffle1969"> and I went up to Gainseville to the North Georgia Celtic Festival after we did some running around and went to her mom's. The festival was neat. Saw a lot of Utilikilts there. Marva bought a new tye-dye outfit and I bought canned haggis and canned whiskey cake!! WOO HOO!! I'll have to make it probably next weekend when she's out installing servers at work.
 She also bought me a shirt that says  "GOT SCOTCH?". And on the back is a map of the Whiskey Trail and all the distilleries along the trail.

 We came home and relaxed for a bit and then went to the movies..

Saw The Island.

 Damn was that a good one!! Bit long in lenght but really well done and kept me on the edge of my seat.
 The story line, the charcaters, the effects were terriffic!! Must see!!

 Just finished mowing the back lawn. Did the front on friday and decided what the hell, I'll mow in my kilt.Right? Wrong!!!
 Half way through got hit by 2 wasps in my ankles. One on the inside of my right ankle and one on the outside of my left ankle, just above my boots and right through the socks!! I'll tell you, it was just like a couple of snow speeders from Empire Strikes Back, taking on an AT-AT!!
 Bastards knew where to hit a large target!!!
 No strange reactions or side effects save lots of itching and massive red spots where they stung me.

 Have more cleaning and laundry to do today. But hopefully my kydex stuff will come in this week and I can start making Schtuff!!

 So what I'm wondering is since Marva may be out doing work stuff next saturday,<lj user="thegreyman">, and <lj user="aggression"> wanna come over and make stuff and have canned haggis with me?

This evening, Freedom Reign is playing at Sportsline in Lawrenceville, C'mon out and see the band play and my Marva sing!! Dammit!!!

 Also  <lj user="aggression"> if you can, c'mon out tonight if your're not doing anything and you and me can talk shop! It's a plug and play so after the band gets set up, not too much to do since I'm not gonna be behind a sound board.

 Here's the address for Sportsline :
(770) 995-5210  	2100 Riverside Pkwy NW
LAWRENCEVILLE, GA 

 My cell is 404-933-2755 if anyone needs help.

Wolf

Taking a break from cleaing up the utility room and making space for my new shop.
 The Work table is painted. Just needs to dry before I can get back to moving stuff around.
 Hopefully I'll be abl;e to order my shop stuff next week and be in production soon.! Can't wait!

 So what do you think of the name: Blackwolf Tactical Designs..

 I think it's got a ring to it.

oh by the way: Freedom reign in playing tonight at: 

Dillons Restaurant & Sports Bar
Address:   	850 Dogwood Rd SW, Lawrenceville, GA 30052
Phone:	(770) 978-4887

I have God to thank for this one!!


 ANAL DWELLING BUTT MONKEY!!!


 OK, not really God, Just Bruce Almighty!!

I went down to ZA to try to hook up with <lj user="aggression"> and no one was there!
 Where'd you go?

 Did it move and I just haven't heard about it????

My latest project  I'm planning to unfold is a custom kydex sheath making business. Part time mind you, Fri-sunday type thing.

 For those of you who don't know what kydex is, it's a thermoplastic that when heated can be applied to an object and when cooled with hold the shape of that object.

 So if anyone's looking for a new sheath for a knife,let me know. This can also be used to make a holster for firearms. But you'd have to bring the gun to me, no ammo or magazine.

 What you'd get for helping me out is a cheap sheath(cost wise mind you, not quaility). Basically price of parts:  about $15. And I get practice and free advertisement.
 I'm looking to have my shop up and running by the end of the month.

 Anyone wanna helpa brother out?

I Am A: Chaotic Good Human Ranger Fighter

Alignment:
Chaotic Good characters are independent types with a strong belief in the value of goodness. They have little use for governments and other forces of order, and will generally do their own things, without heed to such groups.

Race:
Humans are the 'average' race. They have the shortest life spans, and because of this, they tend to avoid the racial prejudices that other races are known for. They are also very curious and tend to live 'for the moment'.

Primary Class:
Rangers are the defenders of nature and the elements. They are in tune with the Earth, and work to keep it safe and healthy.

Secondary Class:
Fighters are the warriors. They use weapons to accomplish their goals. This isn't to say that they aren't intelligent, but that they do, in fact, believe that violence is frequently the answer.

Deity:
Shaundakul is the Chaotic Good god of travel and exploration. He is also known as the Rider of the Winds. His followers are typically rangers, and work to protect the land. They typically wear leather armor, and carry long swords and short bows. Shaundakul's symbol is a white hand with the index finger raised.

Find out What D&D Character Are You?, courtesy ofNeppyMan (e-mail)

 We have clothes, Furniture, knick knacks, books and lots more!!

 C'mon Out!!!

Neanderthal Genome May Be Reconstructed



FRANKFURT, Germany - German and U.S. scientists have launched a project to reconstruct the Neanderthal genome, the Max-Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology said Wednesday.

The project, which involves isolating genetic fragments from fossils of the prehistoric beings who originally inhabited Europe, is being carried out at the Leipzig-based institute.

"The project is very new and is just at its beginning," said Sandra Jacob, a spokeswoman for the institute.

U.S. geneticist Edward Rubin, from the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory in Berkeley, Calif., is also participating in the project.

In an interview with the German weekly Die Zeit, Rubin said the research would amount to more than just a spectacular display of science.

"Firstly, we will learn a lot about the Neanderthals. Secondly, we will learn a lot about the uniqueness of human beings. And thirdly, it's simply cool," Rubin said.

Neanderthals were replaced by modern humans in Europe only between 40,000 and 30,000 years ago.



My whole question is.. Why?

 I mean it's still evident in certain parts of this country. Hell, Just head on down to some of the ship yards I worked at in Mississippi!!!!

 It's quite obvious that there are certain people among us who haven't quite reched the bottom rung of the evolutionary ladder.  LOL

Anyone know where there are some nice trails to ride my new bike?
 I'm not looking for anything wild and off road yet.
 Just some nice trail to ride around and maybe build up my stamina.

Just got home from seeing War of the Worlds..

 Damn

Good

 Movie!!!


 Highly recommend!!

Next week we're ahving a yard sale. Bbut right now we're going through our stuff finding stuff we want to sell/get rid of.
 Does anyone know where we can boxes? Where would be a good place to go look?

 We went behind a thrift store and found some old printer paper boxes but those were quickly used up.

 Any Ideas would be helpful.

We're going through stuff getting ready for our yard sale next weekend and while going through old clothes< Marva had me try on some pants to see if they still fit or not.
 Lemme tell ya what! After wearing kilts for 3-4 months solid now, wearing those jeans, even just to try em on, sucked!!! Been a long time since my crotch was confined like that, and boy, did it suck!!

 I know that eventually down the line I'll have to wear pants again when I go to look for a different job and I anin't looking forward to it!!
when 30 minutes later, all your knives are razor sharp and you have a big bald spot on your left forearm from testing the shaving sharpness of the blades!

Just got back from Little 5 Points.
 Went down to Outback Bikes to pick my my new ride.
 Got in the shop and saw Pete doing inventory again on the kilts.   ????
 He was sending them out today for another event and UK HQ wanted a accurate account of everything. So I wound up lending a hand. I gave Josie, Pete' daughter a hand going through Inventory while I made Pete fill out the UPS labels. Hehehe. I hate those damn things. Thank God for UPS Pick up!!
 So after we got done counting every thing, Pete and I loaded up my truck and drove down to the UPS hub on Pleasantdale rd and dropped the bags off.

 So here was the deal: Pete had a Hardrock speacilized that I liked for $330+. I was gonna put money down on it and do a lay away.
